title: Qamar al-Deen (Apricot Drink)
steps: Cut the apricot leather into small pieces (approximately 2-inch squares).
Place in a deep bowl and cover with water.
Blend the apricot with water and sugar until no lumps remain.
Strain if desired for smoother texture.
Pour into a pitcher and refrigerate until serving.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 package (400g) apricot leather, 3 cups water ≈ 710g, ⅓ cup sugar ≈ 67g
Famous Ramadan beverage from the Middle East
Water and sugar amounts can be adjusted to taste
Homemade apricot leather can be substituted
